boardgame.name: Arcana Academy
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Arcana Academy is a tabletop role-playing game where you get to play as students attending a magical school. Solve mysteries, get into trouble, learn magic, and forge lasting friendships or bitter rivalries.

If you've ever wished you could attend a magical school like Hogwarts or Brakebills, this is the game for you. We wanted to focus on the core experience of what it meant to attend school for the magically gifted and focused all of the rules on these elements. Players will get creative with spells, wander the halls after dark trying to solve mysteries, and explore a world unlike any they've yet experienced.

The game is designed to create these kind of stories whether you have experience with the genre or not. There is a default world filled with characters and their own motivations, locations to explore, and artifacts to discover for those that just want to jump in and start right away. There are also rules for creating your own setting and story. Guided questions will help your group set up their own unique school and story!

boardgame.name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Warcry – Khainite Shadowstalkers
boardgame.description:
The Daughters of Khaine are a fearsome cult that exults in the spilling of fresh blood. Honouring the Lord of Murder, these aelven warriors fight to fulfil the aims of their true mistress, the Shadow Queen Morathi.

Emerge from the shadows to cut down those who would oppose the will of Morathi with the Khainite Shadowstalkers! This warband set allows you to field these aelven killers in your battles, containing:


9 multipart plastic Khainite Shadowstalkers miniatures – 1 Shroud Queen/Shroudblade, 4 Shroudblades with Cursed Swords, 1 Shroudblade with Umbral Spear, 1 Slaughtershade, and 2 Darkflame Warlocks
A Khainite Shadowstalkers abilities card, allowing you to unleash the distinctive and deadly battle tactics of this warband in your games
7 fighter cards for seeing your rules at a glance, plus divider cards for tracking your tokens


What’s more, these deadly warriors are available for use in your Daughters of Khaine Warhammer Age of Sigmar army thanks to a free warscroll available in the Downloads tab.

This set is supplied with 1x Citadel 40mm Round Base and 9x Citadel 28.5mm Round Bases.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Warcry Starter Set

boardgame.name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Warcry – Agents of Chaos
Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Warcry – Diener des Chaos
boardgame.description:
The warriors who pledge themselves to the Dark Gods flock to the Eightpoints like their own promised land. Here, they seek to prove themselves – to conquer, raise their foul offerings, and revel in slaughter. Myriad howling beasts and bloodthirsty Daemons are never far behind, eager to catch the eye of the gods and earn infernal glory.

Agents of Chaos is the essential guide to commanding the forces of Grand Alliance: Chaos in games of Warcry. Nineteen warbands are detailed in full, from festering Maggotkin of Nurgle to vicious skaven. You’ll find loads of new fighter cards, background tables, Fated Quests, and Challenge Battles – in short, everything you need to play the forces of Chaos in full campaigns.

Inside, you’ll find:


Full rules for the following warbands: Beasts of Chaos, Blades of Khorne: Daemons, Blades of Khorne: Bloodbound, Disciples of Tzeentch: Daemons, Disciples of Tzeentch: Arcanites, Maggotkin of Nurgle: Daemons, Maggotkin of Nurgle: Rotbringers, Hedonites of Slaanesh: Daemons, Hedonites of Slaanesh: Sybarites, Skaven, Slaves to Darkness, Iron Golem, Untamed Beasts, Corvus Cabal, Cypher Lords, The Unmade, Splintered Fang, Scions of the Flame, and Spire Tyrants.
Fighter cards for nearly every model available to the Grand Alliance: Chaos ranges.
Rules for three Chaos Allies: Fomoroid Crushers, Ogroid Myrmidons, and Mindstealer Sphiranxes.
New rules for warbands with mixed Faction Runemarks under the same Grand Alliance and more than one Leader.
Refined rules to include Monsters in your warband, as well as new abilities to use against them!
Tables for warrior names, warband origins, and leader backgrounds.
4 Chaos Fated Quests, including Spoils of Victory tables for both Honour and Glory.
6 Chaos Challenge Battles, including special rules and valuable Spoils.


If you desire nothing more than bloodshed in the name of Chaos, this 112-page softback book is for you.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Warcry Starter Set
Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Warcry – Catacombs

boardgame.name: Ulice Śmierci - starter
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Ulice Śmierci to polska gra fabularna opowiadająca o zmaganiach Ocalałych w świecie opanowanym przez hordy zombie! Rozgrywka nastawiona jest na surwiwal, eksplorację i współpracę.

Minęły niecałe dwa lata, od kiedy epi­demia spustoszyła cały kraj. Zara­żeni wirusem ludzie umierają lub zmieniają się w bezmózgie stworzenia, zombie. Te potwory nazywane zdechlakami potrafią zarazić straszliwym wirusem zdrowych ludzi: w większości przypadków ugryzienie zabija lub zmienia nieszczęśnika w zombie.

Prąd i ogrzewanie w obecnych czasach są luksusem. Dostęp do czystej wody i żywności jest bardzo ograniczony. Niedostępność paliwa i innych materiałów napędowych powoduje, że auta stoją porzucone na poboczach. Nigdzie nie można na dłużej zagrzać miejsca, całkowicie bezpieczne schronienia nie istnieją. By przetrwać, należy ciągle się przemieszczać.

Gracze wcielają się w Ocalałych, ludzi, którym zwyczajnie się poszczęściło. Przeżyli, unikając śmiercionośnego wi­rusa i hord zombie. Niektórzy odpo­wiednio wcześniej przewidzieli apoka­lipsę i przygotowali się na najgorsze. Zebrani w niewielką grupę starają się przeżyć kolejny dzień: omijają hordy zombie, szukają bezpiecznego schronie­nia na noc, pożywienia i starają się wy­trzymać psychicznie to, co spotkało cały świat.

Starter zawiera:
podstawowe zasady mechaniki Ulic Śmierci,
6 rodzajów zombie (Szwendacze, Truchła, Biegacze, Mocarze, Zarażeni, Wrzody),
6 gotowych postaci Ocalałych (Polityk, Ochroniarz, Złota Rączka, Policjant, Złodziej i Bezdomna),
gotowy do rozegrania Wypad (scenariusz) zatytuowany "Sweet Alley 13",
Kartę Ocalałego.

Streets of Death is a Polish role-playing game about the struggles of the Survivors in a world overrun by hordes of zombies! The gameplay is focused on survival, exploration and cooperation.

Less than two years have passed since an epidemic ravaged the entire country. People infected with the virus die or turn into a brainless creature, zombies. These monsters can infect healthy people with a terrible virus: in most cases, the bite kills or turns the unfortunate into a zombie.

Electricity and heating are a luxury these days. Access to clean water and food is very limited. The unavailability of fuel and other propulsion materials means that cars are left abandoned on the roadside. No place can be kept warm for long, absolutely safe havens do not exist. To survive, you must constantly be on the move.

Players take on the role of Survivors, people who are simply lucky. They survived by avoiding the deadly virus and hordes of zombies. Some people had anticipated the apocalypse ahead, and prepared for the worst. Gathered in small groups, they try to survive until the next day: they avoid hordes of zombies, look for a safe shelter for the night, food and try to mentally endure what has happened to the whole world.

The starter includes:
the basic mechanics of Death Streets,
6 types of zombies (Walkers, Corpses, Runners, Mighty, Infected, Ulcers),
6 ready-made Survivors (Politician, Bodyguard, Handyman, Policeman, Thief and Homeless),
ready-to-play Script (scenario) entitled "Sweet Alley 13",
Survivor Card.

boardgame.name: Senior Detective Screen
boardgame.description:
From publishers website:
The perfect companion for the Senior Detective. Three panel Game Master's screen. The kids can use the book while you have all you need at a simple glance.

3 panels for a total size of 245 x 170 mm

boardgame.name: Flying Colors: 3rd Edition Update Kit
boardgame.description:
The update kit contains the components needed to update previous versions of Flying Colors to the Flying Colors Deluxe 3rd Printing.

Components:

Updated rulebook (version 3.2)
Updated playbook, containing the scenarios from earlier editions, duel versions of 3 of those scenarios, the scenarios from the Ship of the Line expansion and some new scenarios.
Scenario Pack, containing scenarios from C3i Magazine (C3i 18,21, 23, 25)
Countersheets 5 and 6 from the Deluxe version, containing Ship of the Line ships and commanders and also some updated and new units.
Countersheet 7 from the Deluxe version, containing mostly markers and some updated or new ships and commanders.
2 updated Player Aid Card #1
2 Player Aid Card #2
Turn track/Sequence of Play card
Map D from the Ship of the Line expansion


All components are printed in color, including the play book and the Player Aid Cards.
The update kit comes in a ziplock bag.

boardgame.name: Knights of Underbed
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Explore the dark and dangerous basement, creep into the creepy attic, visit the glorious metropolis of Underbed, or adventure in the Dreamlands all while making sure your child is safe from evil monsters and nightmares that want to suck the happiness out of their lives.

Using this game you play stuffed animals, dolls, and action figures defending your sleeping human children from monsters and nightmares. Play grumpy stuffed dogs, mysterious black cats, energetic tigers, proud space rangers, determined penguins, good monsters, or any type of plush toy you can imagine.

Knights of Underbed uses the TinyD6 game with a setting and theme focused towards family play. It presents accessible, easy to teach, learn and understand rules, as well as carefully crafted content, just for kids and younger audiences!

listing.notes:
New and unused. I sold my retail store, the new owner passed on some items I'm selling here.
Ships FREE via media mail to the lower 48 US, all others email for a quote.

boardgame.name: Knights of Underbed GM Screen
boardgame.description: This is a GM screen for Knights of Underbed RPG.

boardgame.name: The Little Flower Shop Dice Game
boardgame.description:
Spend a relaxing day creating a beautiful display in your little flower shop. Put your carefully arranged bouquets in pretty vases, place them on your shelves, and add cute little knick-knacks as a final touch. Make your shop the envy of all other florists with the most inviting display!

The Little Flower Shop Dice Game, a dice-based take on The Little Flower Shop, is played over six days (rounds). In each round, players simultaneously roll five dice — 3 flower dice, 1 vase die, and 1 initiative die — then take turns based on the initiative die's result. On a turn, you must lock 1-2 dice, or pay money to lock more or none. Unlocked dice must be rerolled on the next turn. When you lock all your dice, you can take an "arrangement tile" that matches your dice roll and place it on a shelf (player board) in your shop. In addition to scoring points for the flowers themselves, you want to accomplish a task set out at the beginning of the game. (Six tasks are included, with only one used each game.)

The player with the best display after six days wins.

-description from designer
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: The Little Flower Shop Dice Game: Daily Goal Pack

boardgame.name: The Trap Manual
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Trap Manual - a book of killing devices - no player is save [sic] unless they are very careful.

boardgame.name: Game Trade Magazine (Issue 251 - Jan 2021)
boardgame.description:
Game Trade Magazine
Issue 251
January 2021

Uk'otoa

boardgame.name: Blood+: Sōyoku no Battle Rondo
boardgame.description: Blood+: Sōyoku no Battle Rondo (BLOOD+ 〜双翼のバトル輪舞曲(ロンド)〜), from Sony Entertainment, is an adventure game released on July 27, 2006. Set during the year between episodes 32 and 33, after Riku's death, the game alternates between an "Active Demo" section where the player can make decisions that change the story line, and full action sequences where the player, as Saya, fights with her sword to collect chiropteran crystals.

boardgame.name: BLOOD+ 〜ファイナルピース〜
Blood+: Final Piece
boardgame.description: Blood+: Final Piece (BLOOD+ 〜ファイナルピース〜) is an adventure role-playing video game that utilizes animated sequences from the series as well as new footage created specifically for the game. The game is set during the first season of the series, and features an original story in which Saya, joined by three friends from school, investigates the mystery of her father's disappearance

boardgame.name: Legendary: A Marvel Deck Building Game – Annihilation
boardgame.description:
A dark new threat has arrived with this Legendary expansion. Annihilus, Lord of the Negative Zone has declared war on anyone who crosses his path, causing heroes and villains to band together against this total annihilation. In defense of the universe, you might see former foes such as Fantastic Four team up with Galactus and his Heralds! It’s time for all to stand side by side against the incoming wave of destruction - stand together, or fall apart.

This is not a stand-alone game. A copy of Legendary: Marvel Deck Building Game is required to play.

—description from the publisher

Game Contents:
Rules insert and 100 cards:
• 5 Heroes (14 cards each — each Hero has 1 rare, 3 uncommons, 5 of one common, and 5 of another common)
• 2 New Villain Groups
• 2 New Masterminds
• 4 New Schemes
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Legendary: A Marvel Deck Building Game

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

listing.notes: Title: Legendary: A Marvel Deck Building Game – Annihilation Publisher: Upper Deck Entertainment Language(s): English

boardgame.name: Candycanes, Inc.
boardgame.description:
You and your fellow player are interns at Candycanes, Inc., tasked to build the best candy cane in time for the holidays.

Place striped cane bits to lengthen your candy cane, and gain a point for white stripes surrounded by red and green. Bows can be used to modify a card midway. Players alternate until either bows or cards run out. The player with the best score wins.

boardgame.name: The Spawn of Xichtul
boardgame.description:
The Children of Chaos are Here!

Chaos has made of Qaarra a wasteland. The unholy forces unleashed by the Drau Derleti – the Dark Elves – have brought the downfall of the Qaarran civilization. The few survivors have succumbed to the taint of chaos. Now warbands of mutant degenerates and bandits roam the wastelands in search of powerful magic and loot, trying to win the appreciation of their dark god Xichtul. Each warband worships a different aspect of the chaos god, but all are ready to kill and maim in his name.

This campaign for Advanced Song of Blades and Heroes includes 6 scenarios and all the rules and traits required to create chaotic bands. It is intended for 2 players.

This is NOT a stand alone book. In addition to this book, a copy of Advanced Song of Blades and Heroes is required to play.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Series: Song of Blades and Heroes
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Advanced Song of Blades and Heroes

boardgame.name: Banco Imobiliário: Rio De Janeiro
boardgame.description:
The classic game Banco Imobiliário from Estrela with the sights of Rio de Janeiro!

The objective of the Game Banco Imobiliário is to become the richest player and the only one to not go bankrupt.

To start the Game, roll the dice and start the first round.
Play the dice and advance.
When you land on an free property you can buy it and start your fortune.
Each time you roll the dice, you must fulfill which indicates the board.
Watch out! You might go to prison if you fall on Go to detention and you will only leave there on bail.
When you finish building houses and hotels, you must wait for a player to go bankrupt in order to buy his properties.
To avoid bankruptcy , you can sell your properties to the Bank for half the price.

The big winner will be the only player who does not go bankrupt.

boardgame.name: Dinn
boardgame.description:
Dinn is an expandable card game where every card is part of an alternate reality puzzle game.

The cards themselves featuring Heroes and Villains from mythology, history, and legend. Dinn's gameplay is inspired by poker and heavily relies on strategy and subterfuge.

Additionally, every card in Dinn is part of a puzzle. Solve the puzzles on these cards to unlock bonus cards for the community.

Every puzzle leads to multi-media, which slowly reveals an interactive, community-driven story.

—description from the designer
boardgame.boardgamepodcastepisode: 066 – Combining Game Genres in Dinn TCG with Gabriel and Hayley

boardgame.name: innsbruck spiel
boardgame.description:
From the Golden Roof to the Hafelekar.
The joyable quiz about local knowledge for everybody who wants to know Innsbruck better.
Travel with you pawn trough the city districts up to the mountain answering questions about culture, sports, nature, history and play some "Activity-actions".
—user summary

Vom Goldenen Dach'l zum Hafelekar
Das vergnügliche Wissensqiuz für alle, die Innsbruck noch besser kennenlernen möchten.
—description from the box

boardgame.name: Metro 2033 - Ranger Pack
boardgame.description: The Ranger Pack introduces two new weapons, the Volt Driver and the Heavy Automatic Shotgun, two new difficulties, Ranger Easy and Ranger Hardcore, that increase all damage ratios, minimalize spare ammo, and almost completely removes the Heads-Up Display. The pack also adds new achievements.

boardgame.name: Star Wars: Legion – Anakin Skywalker Commander Expansion
Star Wars: Legion – Anakin Skywalker Extension Commandant
boardgame.description:
Anakin Skywalker is one of the enduring heroes of the Clone Wars. Whether he is leading troops into battle or personally engaging the enemy using his mastery of the Djem So form of lightsaber combat, he will do what must be done to protect the Republic, even if it leads to temptation by the dark side.

This expansion includes everything you need to have Anakin Skywalker take command of your Republic armies. The beautifully detailed, unpainted hard plastic miniature can be assembled in one of two poses while his three signature command cards allow him to tap into even more power as the battle goes on. Finally, six upgrade cards invite you to explore Skywalker's full potential while his new flawed card provides enemies a weakness to exploit.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Star Wars: Legion
Star Wars: Legion – Clone Wars Core Set

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

listing.notes: German Edition
NIS
New.

boardgame.name: Metro: Last Light – Ranger Mode
boardgame.description: Ranger Mode difficulty (Normal and Hardcore) is available from the main menu when starting a new game. Two new achievements and trophies are also included.

boardgame.name: Metro: Last Light – Faction Pack
Metro: Last Light – Mission 1: Heavy Squad
Metro: Last Light – Mission 2: Kshatriya
Metro: Last Light – Mission 3: Sniper Team
boardgame.description:
Three new and original single-player missions that expand on the Metro universe and includes the terrifying return of librarians. Players take on the role of a Red Line sniper, a Reich Heavy and a Ranger trainee, and their different perspectives during the events of Metro: Last Light. It also features 6 new trophies/achievements.

Mission 1: Heavy Squad - It consists of a single stretch of non-stop combat, with a tremendous number of enemies attacking, lengthy sniper duels with multiple opponents firing at the same time, no consistent safe zones and an enemy encounter near the end that requires as much luck as firing accuracy.

Mission 2: Kshatriya - The longest of the three - but is the single longest level in the Metro Video Game Series, at least up until Exodus which mostly has open-world levels. Unlike most levels, which have Artyom travelling from point A to B or battling a foe, Kshatriya uses new mechanics, such as open world scavenging, to emulate the act of Stalking - venturing up to the surface to retrieve artifacts of the old world.

Mission 3: Sniper Team - a Red Line sniper, along with a spotter infiltrates a heavily guarded Reich outpost on the surface, under the cover of a radioactive storm. The mission is heavily focussed on stealth and alerting the Nazis results in an automatic failure.

boardgame.name: Star Wars: Legion – Darth Maul and Sith Probe Droids Operative Expansion
boardgame.description:
Fueled by his hatred, Darth Maul operates in the shadows, seeking the right moment to take his revenge on the Jedi. This master of the Juyo form of lightsaber combat wields his iconic double-bladed lightsaber to great effect as his Sith probe droids help him hone in on his next target.

With this expansion, you can dispatch Darth Maul and his Sith probe droids to do your bidding. The beautifully detailed, unpainted Darth Maul miniature can be assembled in three distinct poses while his three signature command cards make him a particularly versatile fighter. Finally, eight upgrade cards let you fully fully explore his dark power.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Star Wars: Legion
Star Wars: Legion – Clone Wars Core Set

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

listing.notes: NIS
New.

boardgame.name: Metro: Last Light – Tower Pack
boardgame.description: It includes a challenge-based game mode with an online leaderboard and a combat simulator known as the Tower. It does not revolve around the story of Metro: Last Light though. It also features 2 new trophies/achievements.

boardgame.name: Metro: Last Light – Developer Pack
Metro: Last Light – Mission: Spider Lair
boardgame.description: gives players some interesting tools to explore the world of Metro. Included in the DLC is the Developer Pack level, containing a fully stocked shooting gallery, an AI Arena, a Metro Museum, and an additional mission revolving around the Spiderbugs - Spider Lair. It also features 4 new trophies/achievements.

boardgame.name: Metro: Last Light – Chronicles Pack
Metro: Last Light – Mission 1: Pavel
Metro: Last Light – Mission 2: Khan
Metro: Last Light – Mission 3: Anna
boardgame.description:
new and original story that expands on the Metro Universe. Players take on the role of Anna, Khan and Pavel, in their respective levels, as an accompaniment to Artyom's story. It also features 6 new trophies/achievements.

Mission 1: Pavel - After escaping from Artyom and Simon in Venice, Pavel is recaptured by bandits who reside there. When the level starts, one of them has him tied to a post, torturing him. He tells Pavel they are in a power plant that supplies Venice with energy. However, it is created by human labor. The leader of the bandits has demanded Pavel join the slaves. The bandit prepares to give Pavel an injection that will render him unable to do anything but push the generator, but Pavel slips his hands over the post and attacks the bandit, jamming the syringe in his neck instead before throwing him down a drainpipe.

Mission 2: Khan - The player plays as Ulman, assisting Khan in first stopping a Hansa train occupied by the Red Line, (the same one found in The Chase level) and then fighting Nosalises inside an abandoned Metro station - Polyanka - the same one seen in the Mobius trailer. During a dream sequence in Polyanka, Uhlman temporarily relives the attack on Polyanka by Nosalises, through Khan's eyes (the player plays as a young Khan), in which Khan was forced to close the gate to Polyanka, dooming his friends there.

Mission 3: Anna - The player plays as Anna, assisting Artyom in the Botanical Gardens. The mission is actually a replay of the Ashes level from the main campaign, albeit from Anna's perspective, meaning the player first provides overwatch while Artyom hunts for the Dark One that Khan claimed to have seen, then later extends Ashes by having Anna chase after Artyom after the latter was captured by Reich Stalkers.

boardgame.name: Metro 2033 – Abzats
Metro 2033 – Heavy Automatic Shotgun
boardgame.description: The heavy automatic shotgun is a promotional weapon, requiring a download code to obtain. Once the code is redeemed, there are several chances to obtain the weapon. The code could be obtained through pre-ordering the game or purchasing the "Special Edition" from Gamestop. PC gamers who have bought the game through Valve's Steam service will find that the weapon is included in the purchase as it counts as part of the free DLC.

boardgame.name: Metro: Last Light – RPK Machine Gun
boardgame.description: The RPK machine gun is a new weapon. It was previously only available as a pre-order incentive at select retailers.

boardgame.name: System Gate
boardgame.description:
System Gate is a living card game where two or more players race to reduce their opponent's life to zero. They do this by playing monster, spell, item and finale cards.

There are three spaces on the board - left, center, and right - that monsters can be placed. If there is no monster in a player's center space, they are vulnerable to attack. Players can equip item cards to give them an edge.

There are several factions, called worlds, each specializing in a unique strategy and gameplay.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Small World: Royal Bonus
boardgame.description:
User Summary

A mini expansion that includes three races - Fauns, Igors, and Sylphs - and three special powers - Aquatic, Fireball, and Behemoth.

boardgame.name: Childe of Light: The Golem's Plight Pack
boardgame.description: This DLC contains the Golem quest, which unlocks a new Golem ally. It also includes Erin's Stone and three blue, three red, and three green oculi.

boardgame.name: Pixel Ripped 1995
boardgame.description:
Pixel Ripped 1995. Pixel Ripped is back with a brand new nostalgia-fueled virtual reality game-within-a-game, this time in 1995! Help our hero Dot face challenging throwbacks to all your favorite 16-bit and 32-bit classics while surviving the struggles of a typical nine-year-old kid.

Game website: pixelripped.com

boardgame.name: Detective Di: The Silk Rose Murders
boardgame.description:
User Summary

A computer adaptation of the 18th century Chinese gong'an novels set in the Tang Dynasty (618-907) and based on the real life of Di Renjie. The Silk Rose Murders are a serial killer mystery set in the Chinese capital.

boardgame.name: Heretic Operative
boardgame.description:
User Summary

A story board game in the style of Arkham Horror, you are a magic user in a world where magic is a sin. You face persecution by the church, while alternately fighting off corrupt cults bent on taking over the world. You must build a secret society and mater over 50 spells to defend the world from its own darkest impulses.

boardgame.name: Heretic Operative - Blood Cult
boardgame.description: Adds the Blood Cult story deck to Heretic Operative. Players face cultists who are largely immune to physical damage and who can replace your allies with doppelgangers. This cult unlocks after you reach level 2.

boardgame.name: Gradient Descent
boardgame.description:
Gradient Descent is a sprawling sci-fi megadungeon inspired from fantasy rpgs, movies like Blade Runner, and comics like Blame!:


Hundreds of rooms to explore: Gradient Descent is built from the ground up to be a megadungeon zone that players can return to over many sessions or an entire campaign. They can make quick dives in to scavenge for artifacts, or they can setup camp with the Divers and try and figure out just exactly what's going on down there.



Hordes of Ghosts: The Deep is ultimately a machine. A very complex, godlike machine, but a machine none the less. And inside this machine are ghosts, echoes and reverberations of brainscans taken by the AI in order to build its sentient androids. Players can't kill them, they'll need to be more thoughtful when they approach these beings.



Dozens of unique artifacts: You can make it rich in The Deep if you're a little smart, a little crazy, and very lucky. Gradient Descent comes with dozens of unique artifacts to serve as rewards or objectives to place all around The Deep.



A host of factions: The Deep is crammed with different interests. From the Divers, obsessed humans (?) who plumb the depths of The Deep searching for rare android crafted artifacts, to the various communities of androids all living in fear of their AI overlord, or else, the kill teams and Divers who regularly invade their besieged home.


(From Mothership website)

boardgame.name: The Bloody First
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Doughboys’ face off against unfathomable creatures in the first American Battle of the Great War!

The Doughboys’ squad is part of the third wave of the assault on Cantigny. Their mission is to assist a two-man French flamethrower team in clearing any remaining Germans from the ruined town. Due to the intensity of the Allied bombardment there aren’t many Germans left alive in Cantigny. Many bodies are visible among the wreckage. Even so, there are many cellars, basements, and bunkers that must be checked for holdouts. Going below ground is safer… right?

The world is at war…a war to end all wars.

boardgame.name: Stranger Stuff: Holiday Wish Book
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Holiday-Themed Collection Of Adventure Hooks

Included in this book are over a dozen adventure hooks, ideas for threats, and challenges for a Gamemaster to flesh out themselves fully to have their Kids take on. These hooks are more than “the usual problems of what Christmas gift to get for their snot-nosed siblings; Gamemasters will find stranger ideas included here like twisted Christmas wishes, ominous omens from an Advent Calendar, homicidal men in red suits, and much more!

This book also includes an expanded bestiary of fellow holiday-themed baddies, as well as Stranger Stuff adaptations of all the beasties found in our Tiny Dungeons micro-setting Red Snow!

boardgame.name: The Mystery of Brushgather Farm (5E)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Usable as a standalone adventure to play in 1-2 sessions, or as a side quest in the epic Dark Obelisk Adventure Path, The Mystery of Brushgather Farm is usable with any adventuring party of any level.

A simple farmstead is comprised of a small family of halflings. But when one sister runs away from home and a second goes missing, the third and only remaining child ventures forth to discover what happened to her siblings.

Alone and wracked with guilt and worry, the farm matriarch turns cruel and abusive, and the father seeks comfort in delving ever deeper into the caverns and tunnels underneath the farmhouse... until one day, drawn to the burgeoning evil of the corrupted psyches of the grief-stricken parents, terror and gore seizes what was once a simple farm.

A Complete Adventure... And Much More!
Mystery of Brushgather Farm contains everything you need to run it. In true Infinium Game Studio form, this means what may have been a simple 20-page adventure is instead over 140 pages of richly-detailed content.

This includes:

Redacted, Player Handout versions of each and every map.
A full mini-Bestiary of every monster referenced in the adventure: 27 monsters, each with 4 complete statblocks, for a total of more than 100 statblocks.

boardgame.name: The Mystery of Brushgather Farm (PF1)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Usable as a standalone adventure to play in 1-2 sessions, or as a side quest in the epic Dark Obelisk Adventure Path, The Mystery of Brushgather Farm is usable with any adventuring party of any level.

A simple farmstead is comprised of a small family of halflings. But when one sister runs away from home and a second goes missing, the third and only remaining child ventures forth to discover what happened to her siblings.

Alone and wracked with guilt and worry, the farm matriarch turns cruel and abusive, and the father seeks comfort in delving ever deeper into the caverns and tunnels underneath the farmhouse... until one day, drawn to the burgeoning evil of the corrupted psyches of the grief-stricken parents, terror and gore seizes what was once a simple farm.

A Complete Adventure... And Much More!
Mystery of Brushgather Farm contains everything you need to run it. In true Infinium Game Studio form, this means what may have been a simple 20-page adventure is instead over 140 pages of richly-detailed content.

This includes:

Redacted, Player Handout versions of each and every map.
A full mini-Bestiary of every monster referenced in the adventure: 27 monsters, each with 4 complete statblocks, for a total of more than 100 statblocks.

boardgame.name: Chainmail Style Casting
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This issue? The original wargame Chainmail had casters whose magic was about as reliable as a catapult shot. This takes that 'roll-to cast' mechanic and turns it into a more reliable system that allows casters to have access to more magic while giving them options as to how they use it. Their power drains over time, and drains much faster when they cast more powerful magic.

boardgame.name: Frostdelve: Temple of the Snow Dragon
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Trapped in ice and slowly leached of it's magical power, the snow dragon was carefully guarded by an order of warrior priests.

A printable rpg battlemap compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl or skirmish game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset. The map is 50x50, equivalent to 25 of our standard 10x10 tiles.

Contents: A cave and dungeon complex. At the centre, trapped in ice, is a frozen dragon, linked by chains to magical sigils. A stronghold for warrior priests sits to the north, whilst a temple complex is built into the southern area.

boardgame.name: FCK CDL KLL
boardgame.description:
FCK CDL KLL is a card game of brains and silliness where you find yourself searching for a sharkpig having sex with a pregnant angel or a unicorn killing a yellow snowman or a former president cuddling with the devil.

On a 3x3 tableau of 9 cards, players attempt to create a "Perfect 9" by playing 3 horizontal Trifectas and 3 vertical Trifectas - a Trifecta being 3 cards in a row or column containing the same character. There are 3 "suits" of card FCK, CDL, and KLL and 11 different characters.

A Horizontal Trifecta must have all three suits of card (FCK+CDL+KLL) and a Vertical Trifecta must have all the same suit (i.e., KLL+KLL+KLL)

Each round player may either switch 1 card from the middle tableau of 9 cards to their own tableau of 9 cards or add 9 more cards to the middle.

Additional turns may be gained by achieving a "Holy Trifecta" in which the same two characters appear three times in a row.

FCK cards can be used to switch cards from tableaus of their opponents.

boardgame.name: Know Nine?
boardgame.description:
Get ready for the fast-paced lateral thinking game that will make your palms sweat, your brain buzz, and your mouth ramble!

Link all the words on the grid, but be quick, you’ve only got a minute!

Only unique answers count and you’ll need to use your powers of persuasion to score.

Your competitors decide if your answers are allowed, so you need to be convincing when you argue your case.

Do you know nine, and will you score at all?!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Brocken
boardgame.description:
Brocken is the second of a trilogy of games from the Japanese group ᚫ ᚱ ᛏ ᛖ ᛗ ᛁ ᛋ ᛁ ᚫ (Artemisia), which centre around the Witches' Sabbath, Walpurgis Night. Brocken is the highest peak in the Harz mountains in northern Germany. In folklore, it was the gathering place for witches to celebrate their rites (Goethe writes of it in his work Faust).

In this game, three witches must travel to Brocken to join their coven. Having already prepared their flying potions in the previous game, they now fly using a chair, a broomstick and a goat to carry them. They must pass through the perilous woodlands and swamps, and avoid the spiders.

The game is for three players only. Each player has a deck of cards, each showing a rune. There is a set of three dice, also with the runes. One player throws the dice, and the players must try to match the runes thrown with their hand cards. This allows them to move across the forest, as the cards each have special actions (such as move three places, or bring other witches to you).

The first player to successful get to the peak at Brocken is the winner.
user summary
boardgame.boardgamepublisher: ᚫ ᚱ ᛏ ᛖ ᛗ ᛁ ᛋ ᛁ ᚫ (Artemisia)

boardgame.name: Ogniste Lato
boardgame.description:
It is a scenario for Tales from the Loop, published by the Polish publisher of the game - Black Monk.

From publisher's site:

Ogniste lato to przygoda do gry fabularnej Tajemnice Pętli osadzona w realiach polskich lat 80., których nigdy nie było.
Scenariusz przeznaczony jest dla grupy od 2 do 5 graczy, a jego rozegranie powinno zająć jedną sesję.

Tegoroczne wakacje w Rembertowie są zupełnie inne od dotychczasowych. Panująca od maja susza i brak opadów spowodowały, że w całej Polsce wybuchają pożary łąk i lasów. Nawet w Rembertowie czuć w powietrzu spaleniznę, a niebo przybiera niepokojąco pomarańczowy kolor. Obowiązują zakazy wstępu do lasu, co uprzykrza życie Dzieciakom, które na razie nie wyjechały na żadne obozy ani kolonie. Małolaty walczą z nudą, snując się po betonowych ulicach, i mimo zakazów cichcem przemykają do okolicznych, suchych jak wiór lasów. Właśnie tam odnajdą coś, co będzie początkiem wielkiej i pełnej niebezpieczeństw przygody.

Informacje dodatkowe:
Liczba stron: 12
Wydruk: w kolorze
Okładka: miękka
Format: A4

boardgame.name: Vorbereitung zur Walpurgisnacht
boardgame.description:
Vorbereitung zur Walpurgisnacht is the first of a trilogy of witchcraft games from the Japanese coterie circle ᚫ ᚱ ᛏ ᛖ ᛗ ᛁ ᛋ ᛁ ᚫ (Artemisia). The game is for three players only, and has the three witches concocting their flying potions, to be used in the successive game Brocken, when they fly for Walpurgisnacht.

The original game has a trifold game board of thick card, with different sections to complete the potions. There is a large deck of cards for the ingredients (frogs, Nightshade, Wormwood and so on). There are also some coloured minerals used as markers, and the game was delivered in a cloth pouch.

The later edition is boxed and upgraded to a wooden board and a d4 die is added, along with an ingredients card.

Players use the cards from their hand to collect the ingredients and brew their potion. The first witch to succeed wins the game and takes flight to Brocken...
user summary
boardgame.boardgamepublisher: ᚫ ᚱ ᛏ ᛖ ᛗ ᛁ ᛋ ᛁ ᚫ (Artemisia)

boardgame.name: Circino: le Chasseur de Trésors – Destination Yvelines
boardgame.description:
Circino A Treasure Hunt in the Yvelines

From Versailles à Sartrouville, via Rambouillet, Trappes, Chambourcy etc ... 36 municipalities of the "78" department will occupy a central and predominant spot in the game.

Goal of the game
The players select 8 "Objective" cards (= 8 communes) and they collect the 8 "Objective" pellets corresponding to these 8 cards. They shuffle them face down then place them on the different chests on the game board.

Each player then collects at random or he chooses 2 "Objective" cards among the 8 selected.

The goal of the game will consist in finding the 2 “Objective” pellets corresponding to his 2 cards then in bringing them back the 1st to Circino in the center of the board ... with as only weapons the dice and his sense of adventure!

In their quest, players will not be alone and can count on the help of members of the Circino family through Bonus Cards.

boardgame.name: ALCOR Station Fuel & Services
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Thousands of ALCOR stations dot known space serving cheap fuel cores, lousy "entertainment" and questionable culinary choices.

GIVE YOUR PLAYERS A BREAK AND JUST ENJOY A LITTLE REST IN OUR INSTALLATIONS!

This pamphlet module for MOTHERSHIP presents you with a safe place for your players to rest and relieve stress... as long a something doesn't goes wrong!

Here you will find:

A complete overview of the ubiquitous ALCOR station and all it's services.
6 portraits of the ALCOR station staff in JPG files for you to print or use online.
5 things that can go really wrong when your players visit one of ALCOR stations.
3 tables for generating drinks, smokes and food for your players to enjoy.
2 space monsters more than happy to gut your players.

boardgame.name: Sweetlandia
boardgame.description:
Have you ever dreamed of a place made entirely of delicious treats? Now you can realize that dream by becoming a city planner for the beautiful and tasty, Sweetlandia!

Use Bidding Cards to acquire building areas from a delectable collection of locations: Gumdrop Garden, Rocky Road, Marshmallow Mountain, Lemonade Lake, Candy Cornfields, and many others. Choose the right locations to achieve your goals and earn the most Donuts from Mayor McSweet. Make good choices, and watch Sweetlandia grow!

It's fun. It's unpredictable. It's...sweet! And you don't need a sweet tooth to win!

—description from the publisher

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

listing.notes: Title: Sweetlandia Publisher: Ultra PRO Language(s): English

boardgame.name: Ticinum: Il gioco di Pavia
boardgame.description:
In Ticinum: Il gioco di Pavia you get to buy the most popular streets and squares in the city, then increase their value by building houses, churches and towers.

You can graduate by passing through the University, thus gaining unique powers to change the tide of the game.

The event cards are comparable to those of Monopoly and represent historical commercial activities and monuments.

The pawns are personalized: Bonarda, salami, barcè, fog and mosquitoes.

Instead of Euros, the currency is "franchises".

The primary purpose of the game is the enhancement of the city of Pavia.

This game was also created to fight gambling; in 2013 Pavia was described by the New York Times as the capital of gambling.

boardgame.name: Design By Committee
boardgame.description:
Design by Committee is a competitive/cooperative game of product development. Every player will work to achieve both their own, individual Requirements as well as the Requirements of the product as a whole.

Gameplay advances over the course of multiple games. You earn or lose points each game depending on the outcome of the product and your overall success in simultaneously achieving your own personal goals. The first player to earn 50 or more total points (as an ongoing score across multiple games) is the winner. There is no minimum score, players can freely go into negative numbers.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Dungeons & Dilemmas: The Dungeon as Narrative Framework and Encounters as Moral Puzzles
boardgame.description:
Publisher's description:

You are exploring a tomb in search of a mirror fabled to foretell the future. You discover the tomb is inhabited by an undead queen and her spectral knights. In your exploration you have learned that she was murdered by the patriarchal structures of her own holy order. The method of her execution has denied her eternal rest. She plans murderous vengeance against the living but offers mercy under two conditions. First, help install her as an eternal monarch upon the religious throne. Second, eradicate the bloodline of those who betrayed her. What do you do?

Dungeons & Dilemmas is a collection of system agnostic techniques for designing dungeon-based adventures that engage the players on an emotional and ethical level. The process within approaches dungeons as their own unique narrative structure, and individual encounters as moral puzzles.

Dungeons & Dilemmas treats deeper emotional engagement as an additional dimension of play on top of the exploration, hazard avoidance, monster fighting, treasure collection and other traditional elements of fantasy adventure games. All the ideas, tools, and techniques presented speak to the strengths of existing rule systems in common use. GMs and players won't have to hand-wave away or house rule their games to accommodate this material.

boardgame.name: Cat-Tastic
boardgame.description:
Owning a cat is full of adventure, and many unexpected things can happen along the way--so get ready! Be the first to collect six hearts by showing how well you care for cats, and win!
—description from the back of the box

Cat-Tastic plays on a roll-and-move board with spaces along the perimeter (picture monopoly). The various spaces either cause you to gain or lose money, or draw a card with an event, or adopt a cat to gain a heart. The cards generally require you to pay money to a specific business (or to the bank if the business is not owned), with some of the cards rewarding a heart afterwards.

At the start of the game, you choose a cat care business to own (two businesses in a 2 player game), like vet, or groomer. The business will interact with some of the event cards, and may also have a cost to maintain. You may also purchase additional businesses during the game.

As long as you don't go bankrupt, you go around the board and collect hearts until someone wins by collecting 6 hearts.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Deutschland Reise
boardgame.description: Discover Germany by playing, what can be done faster? First visit Winnetou in Bad Segeberg and then visit the largest wine barrel in the world in Heidelberg? Or first to the cathedral in Cologne? The players from Deutschlandreise go on an exciting and informative journey across Germany. The goal: Visit eight cities and be the first to return to the pre-determined starting point. The players plan an ideal travel route for this. You can expect over two hundred sights such as the Brandenburg Gate or interesting towns such as Rothenburg ob der Tauber. These are presented to you in words and pictures. With interesting action cards your own journey can be accelerated or that of the other players slowed down! With good planning, a bit of luck with the dice and the clever use of your action cards, you will be the first to end the exciting journey through Germany.

boardgame.name: Tru Action Electric Baseball Game
boardgame.description: Tru Action Electric Baseball Game is a baseball game in which the batter uses a spring-loaded flipper to toss a magnet from behind home plate and onto the metal board to determine the results of a pitch. The board has marked areas to show hits and outs while landing on a line is a strike and between marked areas is a ball. If the batter gets a hit, they can flip a switch to vibrate the board and their batter will start to run the bases. They can stop when they reach base — but when a hit occurs, the fielder uses their flipper from behind the outfield to try to throw out runners as they head for the next base.

boardgame.name: You Are Rare in the Snow
君は雪間に希う
boardgame.description: Visual Novel

boardgame.name: Puppy Trek
boardgame.description:
Players race puppies through a Pacific Northwest inspired whimsical gameboard.

In this D6 roll-to-move, players weigh tradeoffs between pausing to pick up more resource cards and pushing through, racing to reach home first. Cards allow additional movement or setting rivals back on the path, at limited opportunities. Cards and special board spaces involve the players performing simple no-stakes in-the-real-world physical (e.g., hop like a frog) and mental (e.g., answer a question or spell a word) activities.

boardgame.name: Dino Battle: Logical Game.
boardgame.description:
Long ago, in the Mesozoic era, dinosaurs dominated the Earth for many millions of years. They fought for survival in the thriving prehistoric jungle and evolved in constant battle with their own kind.

The game Dino Battle invites you to make an exciting journey into the era of dinosaurs and by choosing your own kind - lead it to dominance on the planet! Build a colony of your kind in a winning combination or don't let your opponent do it. The logic battle will not leave indifferent any player!

During each round, players take turns laying out the tiles of creatures of their kind on the board, trying to fulfill the conditions of victory. As soon as one of the players fulfills them, the round ends immediately:

Plants
They win when they manage to build a straight line vertically, horizontally, or diagonally from 5 consecutively placed tiles of their kind.

Ceratops
They win when they manage to build a straight line vertically, horizontally, or diagonally from 4 consecutively placed tiles of their kind.

T-Rexes
They win when they manage to build a straightline vertically, horizontally, or diagonally from 3consecutively placed tiles of their kind.

Pterodactyls
They win when they lay out the 5th tile of their kind on the board, regardless of the relative position of these tiles.

boardgame.name: Taskmaster Game: Expansion Pack
boardgame.description:
Welcome to the TASKMASTER Game Expansion Pack!

Inside this box, you will get:


40 all-new task cards to add to your Taskmaster Board Game
The opportunity to access exclusive Final Video Tasks
10 Prize Task selector cards
50 paper refill slips for your stunning self-portraits
Your very own little Taskmaster’s Assistant!
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Taskmaster: The Board Game

boardgame.name: The American Professional Football Game, 1920-1949
boardgame.description:
The American Professional Football Game, 1920-1949, is a print-and-play solitaire educational board game that teaches you the history of professional football from the inception of the American Professional Football Association in 1920 through the National Football League’s 1949 gridiron season.

Your goal is to help professional football survive and thrive by spending Moxie points and attempting to activate inactive teams, stabilize unstable teams, hire and move players and other contributors to teams, lobby for new stadiums, and scout out new independent professional teams. You must also play exhibition games to help those independent professional teams earn the Bona Fide status and to earn more Moxie points.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Mi Butto... O Non Mi Butto...
boardgame.description: Mi Butto... O Non Mi Butto is a card game in which players are trying to create sets of cards that contains: one sky card, one plane card and one paratrooper card. When a set is complete you can add a "landing" card to score points. Other players can try to block your sets using their cards. At the end of the game, the player with the most points, wins.

boardgame.name: Trover Saves the Universe - Important Cosmic Jobs
boardgame.description: You’ll get to explore Trover’s workplace, meet his weirdo colleagues, and deal with his insane bosses. It’ll be just like real life! Only less depressing!

boardgame.name: Le Grand Jeu: Alix
boardgame.description:
A family strategy game accessible to all: those who already love the world of Alix and those who are discovering it!

From 2 to 3 players individually,
From 4 to 6 players in a team.




Set off on a race through the Roman Empire to visit the cities to which Rome sends you on missions.
Stop off in the great cities of the ancient world and be the first to return to Rome once your missions are completed
Use strategy and beware of your opponents or the twists of fate.


May the gods be with you!

boardgame.name: Hardwar: Advanced Warfare – World Introduction
boardgame.description:
This is the introduction to the world of Hardwar.

Hardwar is a fast-paced tactical combat game set in plausible future of dawning 22nd century - a blend of dystopia and utopia in which nations are squeezed by the pressure of super-powerful corporations, and yet space travel beyond the borders of our solar system lies tentatively within our grasp. Many challenges of disease and poverty seem to have been overcome, yet the megawealthy continue to treat the world as a playground that bends to their whim.

In such an environment, full-blown war is rare. But small, secretive conflicts of fierce intensity are commonplace and corporations employ “security forces” with access to top-level military hardware in numbers that would put many smaller nations’ militaries to shame.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Vikings Gone Wild: Saga Mega Expansión
boardgame.description:
Each turn in Vikings Gone Wild — a deck-building, resource management game based on the online real-time strategy game — players can either buy permanent buildings sitting in front of them (resource factories, resources containers, etc) or buy units, towers and special cards that improve their deck and offense/defense capacity.

The only way to win is by successfully attacking each other, and each attack involves interesting bluffing mechanisms in which the attacker doesn't know the defense capacity of their opponent...

This compilation contains the four expansions of the game: Masters of Elements, Ragnarok!, Guild Wars, and It's a Kind of Magic.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Vikings Gone Wild
boardgame.boardgamecompilation: Vikings Gone Wild: It's a Kind of Magic
Vikings Gone Wild: Masters of Elements

boardgame.name: Order-Up: Burger Edition
boardgame.description: Order-Up: Burger Edition is a fast, fun, burger-matching card game that is perfect for the whole family. Race against your fellow cooks to complete five orders, but don't forget to yell "Order-Up!"

boardgame.name: Raus aus'm Loch!
boardgame.description:
Each player gets ten tokens (white or black) and two dice. The two players move in opposite directions. White beginns to roll the dice and the players set their tokens on spaces one to six (two tokens for each roll, first the lower number, than the higher one). If all tokens are placed in section I the tokens are moved into section II and III according to the roll of the dice. From now on only one token may be placed on a space. Only when the lower number may be used the higher number may be used too. If doubles are rolled, the upper numbers are used first, then the numbers on the bottom of the dice. The goal is to move all tokens through section IV. Spaces 19 to 24 may only be occupied by two tokens at the same time, when empty.

The first player who manages to occupy three spaces in section IV with at least two tokens each, wins half the contents of the cash box.

The first player to get all his tokens out of the game (beyond space 24) wins the game and the rest of the contents of the cash box.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Würfelkitschen
boardgame.description:
A dice action game in a wooden box with a felt carpet in it. Target of the game is to get as much point after 12 rounds by throwing dices in the wooden box to manipulate own dices and dices of all other players.

There are special rules for single player game or 2 player game, too.

—user summary

listing.notes: Hello, i am the developer of Würfelkitschen. Ask me anything or order the game by contacting me at wuerfelkitschen@gmx.de! You have to transfer the money including the postage at first; sorry no other way possible!

boardgame.name: Le Carnaval des Animaux
Carneval Zoo
Carnival Zoo
boardgame.description:
Dressing a hippopotamus or a rhino for the Grand Ball of animals is not easy, especially if you want to be the first to do so.

A fun game teaching to think, recognize shapes, and appreciate the beauty of colors.

Use the spinning wheel to find out the color of the square you're moving to. Pick up the shape you see in that square, and put it on your animal to dress it.

The first to dress completely his animal, wins.

translated from the Italian box cover

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: トゥルーマリンショー2 (True Marine Show 2)
boardgame.description:
Marine may have gathered her sailors and put herself back together again, but now Space Marine appears from another dimension. The journey to collect characters from Azur Lane, Touhou Project, and hololive begins anew.

Play sailors from your hand to gain Vtuber Points (VP) in order to purchase more powerful sailors from the market and improve your deck. This time around, many abilities focus on removing cards from your deck as the game goes on in order to perform more powerful actions and get extra VP. The game ends at the end of the round when a player reaches 20 or more VP. Whoever has the most VP is the winner.
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Video Game Theme: Project Shrine Maiden
boardgame.boardgameintegration: トゥルーマリンショー (True Marine Show)
トゥルーマリンショー3 (True Marine Show 3)
トゥルーマリンショー (True Marine Show)
トゥルーマリンショー3 (True Marine Show 3)

boardgame.name: Escape Game: Disney Villains
boardgame.description:
The villains of the Disney universe are unleashed! Jafar, Maleficent, Ursula, Hades and the Queen of Hearts are ready to do anything to carry out their Machiavellian plans. Play as Disney's bravest heroes and heroines and travel from Wonderland to Agrabah to complete your quest.

The Escape Room range is inspired by the Escape Room rooms. Find their incredible atmosphere at home! Go on an adventure, observe, manipulate and solve various puzzles that will put your logical mind to the test. Uncover fantastic puzzles, travel through legendary landscapes from Disney films and overcome the five big villains!

This Escape Game contains 5 scenarios of 60 minutes each.

boardgame.name: Трикветр
boardgame.description:
Nano game on one card (board on a side, rules on the other side) for two players. You need to provide four D6 dices.
It's a simple game with a math mechanic. The Player chooses dice and places them in special fields. On the player's turn, he can change the dice value downside or place another dice. But be careful, each field have a special number, so you can’t change a value lower than this number. A player who can't do his turn loses this game.
KOZAK Games Publishing shared this game as a gift for their customers in 2020 (COVID-19 Pandemic)

boardgame.name: Шифр
boardgame.description:
Nano game on one card (board on a side, rules on the other side) for two players or more. For playing this game you also need to provide mobile phone or paper with pen for each player. Each player get the encrypted code from another player and try to decode it. It's a simple game with an encryption mechanic.
KOZAK Games Publishing shared this game as a gift for their customers in 2020 (COVID-19 Pandemic)

boardgame.name: Verlies Navidad (Issue 2 - 2019)
boardgame.description:
Aus dem Vorwort

Liebe Leserinnen und Leser,
das Jahr neigt sich erneut dem Ende entgegen, viele Abenteuer liegen hinter uns, aber noch nicht alle sind bestanden! Dafür hat erneut Kaid Ramdani gesorgt, der hier mit dem zweiten Verlies Navidad erneut drei weihnachtliche Szenarien für unsere Spiele geschrieben hat. Da wäre zum einen ein ungewöhnliches Szenario, ganz im Stile des Anhangs N. Es ist für Beyond the Wall gedacht, kann aber auch leicht für andere Old School Rollenspiele verwendet werden und einen Stern zum Thema. Dagegen hat der Krampus seinen ersten Auftritt in Geh nicht in den Winterwald und auch hier steht der Stern im Mittelpunkt. Und schließlich gibt es einen Trichter für Dungeon Crawl Classics, bei dem sich die Charaktere mit der Schneekönigin konfrontiert sehen. Werden sie ihrem Eispalast entkommen können?
boardgame.rpg: Beyond the Wall and Other Adventures
Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game

boardgame.name: Verlies Navidad (Issue 3 - 2020)
boardgame.description: contains chrismas-inspired scenarios for Mythos World, Dungeon World, Beyond the Wall, and a system-agnostic "Escher" dungeon for OSR games.
boardgame.rpg: Beyond the Wall and Other Adventures

boardgame.name: Zine of High Adventure (Nr. 1 - Okt 2020)
boardgame.description: This issue contains various random tables (e.g. strange jungle encounters, treasures found in a jungle temple, offers and their prices on a goblin market), and a patron for DCC.
boardgame.rpg: Beyond the Wall and Other Adventures
Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game

boardgame.name: Elfenwolf (Retroausgabe #01 - Okt 2020)
boardgame.description: This retro issue combines new content with DSA texts from the original issues of the 1990s, rewritten for other rpg systems like Dungeon World.
boardgame.rpg: Beyond the Wall and Other Adventures

boardgame.name: Ale Pary: Misz Masz
boardgame.description: Ale Pary: Misz Masz features gameplay identical to that of Spot it! 1,2,3, with the game consisting of 31 cards, each showing six images. Any two cards have exactly one image in common, and your challenge when playing is to spot what that matching image is before anyone else.

boardgame.name: Leviathan (Ausgabe 2 - 1986)
boardgame.description: Published late in 1986, the second issue contains various articles, part 2 of a solo adventure, and materials für DSA and other games.

boardgame.name: Trial And Terror
boardgame.description: Retro maze awaits! Welcome to Trial and Terror, a surreal, abstract and dark world of challenges awaiting to be beaten.

boardgame.name: Leviathan (Ausgabe 3 - März 1987)
boardgame.description:
Issue #3 continues the solo adventure from previous issues, contains a tabletop/ cosim scenario and a module for Call of Cthulhu, plus various other materials.


no. 3 was announced for March 1987 in the previous issue, but there's no date in/on the issue -but no indication that it was delayed, either. Next issue is announced for the start of June 1987.
no mention of the previous publisher, Rollenspiel-Club Zülpich.

boardgame.name: Rick and Morty: Find the Morty
boardgame.description:
Roll the dice, then be the first to grab the right Morty!

Place the 36 Morty cards on a table, then roll the dice to give a Morty species, effect and accessory. The first player to grab the correct Morty wins the round. Be the first player to grab 5 Mortys to win the game!
